sub_topic: Determining the chromatic number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the chromatic number of the given graph?

```
    A---B
    |\ /|
    | X |
    |/ \|
    C---D---E
```

Note: The chromatic number of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color the vertices of the graph such that no adjacent vertices have the same color.
message_2:
The chromatic number of the given graph is 3.

Here's one way to color the graph with three colors:

Color 1: A, D
Color 2: B, C
Color 3: E, X

No adjacent vertices have the same color, so the chromatic number is 3.
